result.execSummary:
The defendant Brendan Castaneda was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*Huber privileges granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department for work, counseling and other reasons the sheriff may allow.
Concurrent with: with 15CF37

miscConds.notes: Pay costs.   If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Pay restitution: Target $869.94. (Bond applied to restitution.)

supervisions.notes:
*Same huber as count 1.
Concurrent with: with Count 1 and 15CF37

miscConds.notes:
*Comply with conditions in 15CF37
**no expungement on misdemeanor file

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brendan Castaneda

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brendan Castaneda in court with attorney Robert A. Gardner. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 15CF37 (sentencing), 15CM234 and 14TR3727 (plea/sentencing).

9:38 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Gardner and Atty Cousins request additional time to attempt to resolve the 15CM234 and 14TR3737 cases.
9:40 a.m.  Court is in a brief recess.
9:55 a.m.  Court is back in session and recalls the cases.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.

10:08 a.m.  15CF37:
Atty Gardner was to be calling the counselor of his client; the counselor does not appear at this time but Atty Gardner does wish to provide a one page summary to the Court.  No objection by the State.
Court and counsel have received their copies of the PSI.
Court questions if any correction need to be made on the record.
Atty Gardner provides his corrections of the PSI on the record.
Prosecutor argues regarding sentencing.
Attorney for Defendant argues regarding sentencing.
10:23 a.m.  Atty Gardner presents the summary of the counselor to the parties.
Atty Gardner moves to admit the statement to the Court; no objection by the State.
Defendant makes a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 -
Impose/Stay 3.5 year prison - confinement 1.2 years and extended supervision 2 years
Placed on probation for 24 months
***Conditions of Probation and extended supervision:
*Serve 60 days in jail with 1/2 of the sentence to be in jail and 1/2 of the sentence to be served on electronic home monitor if qualifies for this program and approved by the risk assessment
*Huber privileges granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department for work, counseling and other reasons the sheriff may allow
*Jail credit TBD - Atty Gardner granted 10 days to verify
*Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
*Must report today for start date.
*Pay $500 fine plus costs and DNA Surcharge
*Provide DNA Sample 
*Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Walmart, Kohls, Best Buy, Menards and Target without there consent or agents consent or with co-defendant Dakota Beebout
*Obtain and maintain full-time employment until restitution is paid or schooling or a combination of both to equal full-time 
*Write apology letters to all victims involved and provide to agent to be done within 60 days 
*Pay restitution:
Kohls - $0.00
Walmart - $0.00 (pursuing a civil action)
Best Buy - $379.99
Menards - $347.84
Target - $869.94
*Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent and comply with any other assessments, treatment and programming as deemed appropriate by the Compass Assessment and the Department of Corrections
*Granted expungement upon successful completion of probation and recommended by the agent - if restitution not paid by the end of the probation then no expungement

Counts 2, 3 & 4 were DRI

*********************************************************************************************************************

9:55 a.m.  15CM234 and 14TR3727:

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CM234:
Count 1 - Guilty
Count 2 - Guilty

14TR3727:
Count 1 - DRI

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 & 2 of 15CM234 and Count 1 of 14TR3727 is DRI.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

State has complied with victim notification; no victims appear today.
Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Gardner makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant does not wish to make a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
15CM234:
Count 1 -
Impose 120 day jail sentence concurrent to 15CF37
*Huber privileges granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department for work, counseling and other reasons the sheriff may allow
*Placed on probation for 24 months to run concurrent to 15CF37
*Pay costs
*Comply with conditions in 15CF37

Count 2 - 
Impose 120 day jail sentence concurrent to 15CF37 and Count 1  
*Huber privileges granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department for work, counseling and other reasons the sheriff may allow
*Placed on probation for 24 months to run concurrent to Count 1 and 15CF37
*Pay costs 
*Comply with conditions in 15CF37
**no expungement on misdemeanor file 

14TR3727:
Count 1 - DRI

**Defendant provided with the explanation of Determinate Sentence

11:09 a.m. Defendant Brendan Castaneda in court with attorney Robert A. Gardner. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
 Parties request PSI report for 15CF37 Ct 1. 15CF37 cts 2 - 4 and 15CF80 to be DRI.  Case 15CM234 and 14TR3727 to track along.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CF37 Guilty and 15CF80 Guilty

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CF37 Ct 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
 15CF37 cts 2 - 4 and 15CF80 are Dismissed Read In.  
Cases 15CM234 and 14TR3727 to track along.

BY THE COURT:***PSI report ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Brendan Castaneda in court with attorney Robert A. Gardner. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 15CF-37, 15CM-234 and 15CF-80.

2:01 PM Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Address of Defendant is verified.

Atty Cousins states matter was set for a plea today but received a phone call, stating Defendant is not ready to enter a plea today.

Atty Gardner addresses the Court, requests matter adjourned for reasons stated on the record, requests 30 days.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

No contact with Target in Stevens Point.
No contact with co-defendants Luke Aitken and Amanda Rosnostik.

Defendant Brendan Castaneda in court with attorney Robert A. Gardner. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

NOT GUILTY plea entered.

State recommends a $500 signature bond with conditions as stated.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
